questions.question: What would you have done if you had won the lottery?
questions.answer: I would have traveled the world.
options: I would have traveled the world.

questions.question: Imagine a future where time travel exists. Yesterday, a scientist missed the chance to stop a catastrophe because his machine failed. What is the correct third conditional sentence?
questions.answer: If the machine had worked, he would have prevented the catastrophe.
options: If the machine didn’t fail, he would stop the catastrophe.
If the machine had worked, he would have prevented the catastrophe.
If he prevents the catastrophe, the machine works.
If the scientist worked harder, he stops the catastrophe.

questions.question: What would she have done if it had rained?
questions.answer: She would have stayed at home.
options: She would have stayed at home.
